name: Dan Blanchard
body:
![Me on the Golden Gate Bridge](http://www.eecis.udel.edu/~blanchar/files/dscn2000.jpg)

I’m an Associate Research Engineer in the NLP group at [ETS](http://www.ets.org/) and a former PhD candidate in [Computer & Information Sciences](http://www.cis.udel.edu/) at the [University of Delaware](http://www.udel.edu/). My co-advisors were [Jeffrey Heinz](http://phonology.cogsci.udel.edu/~heinz/) and [Vijay Shanker](http://www.cis.udel.edu/~vijay/), and my research centered on building an unsupervised word segmentation model using insights from infant language acquisition research.

I’m originally from [Oley, PA](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oley_Valley), and I attended [Millersville University](http://www.millersville.edu/) for my BS in Computer Science. I have both an MS in Computer Science and an MA in [Linguistics & Cognitive Science](http://www.ling.udel.edu/) from the University of Delaware.
